author: Denise Blostein
title: The Olympics Superfan: How a Free Trip Started a Two-Decade Tradition
text:
0 COMMENTS For Ron Isbell, the Olympics don’t end. When he isn’t traveling to see the games themselves, the now-retired accountant is planning for the next one.
His trip to South Korea marks his 12th time seeing the Olympics live. The Texas native won his first trip to Calgary’s 1988 games from a local radio station in Arlington. His next Olympics was Atlanta in 1996.
“They showed the preview that the next games were going to be in Sydney, Australia,” Mr. Isbell says, “I sat there, and I thought, let’s just go to Sydney.”
Watch more Olympics videos here Since then, Mr. Isbell has been to every Olympics games -- both winter and summer. He trades pins, collects t-shirts, but mostly, he is there to see the action.
In this video, Mr. Isbell shows off his collection of memorabilia and travels to Pyeongchang, South Korea, for yet another Olympics.
He is confident it won’t be his last.
